descriptions: The student does not identify any conflict resolution strategies.
The student identifies only one conflict resolution strategy, but it is not clearly explained or appropriate for the given scenario.
The student identifies one conflict resolution strategy and provides a basic explanation, but its appropriateness is questionable.
The student identifies two conflict resolution strategies and provides a reasonable explanation for each.
The student identifies three conflict resolution strategies, explains them well, and indicates why they are appropriate for the situation.
The student identifies multiple conflict resolution strategies, explains them thoroughly, and justifies their use with nuanced understanding of the conflict dynamics.
The student does not demonstrate any understanding or application of nonviolent communication principles.
The student attempts to use nonviolent communication but demonstrates misunderstanding or misapplies the principles.
The student demonstrates a basic understanding of nonviolent communication but struggles to apply it effectively.
The student applies nonviolent communication principles adequately, with some minor inconsistencies or areas for improvement.
The student consistently and effectively applies nonviolent communication principles to propose solutions.
The student expertly applies nonviolent communication principles, demonstrating empathy, understanding, and respect for all parties involved while proposing innovative solutions.
The student fails to analyze the conflict scenario or identify the underlying issues.
The student provides a superficial analysis of the conflict scenario, missing key details and underlying issues.
The student identifies some of the surface-level issues in the conflict but does not delve into the root causes.
The student provides a reasonable analysis of the conflict, identifying most of the key issues and some of the underlying causes.
The student offers a comprehensive analysis of the conflict, identifying the key issues, underlying causes, and potential consequences.
The student demonstrates exceptional analytical skills, dissecting the conflict with keen insight, identifying subtle nuances, and predicting potential outcomes with accuracy.
